q: Donald Rumsfeld is starting to make Robert McNamara look good. At least Robert McNamara felt sorry at the end for all those lives and limbs lost because of his colossal misjudgments and cretinous refusal to admit mistakes. We do not have the God-given right to shape every nation in our image or as we choose, a penitent Robert McNamara said. John McCain told ABC television: I respect secretary Donald Rumsfeld . He and I had a very, very strong difference of opinion about the strategy he was employing in Iraq, which I predicted was doomed to failure. Thank God he was relieved of his duties and we put the surge in. Otherwise we would have had a disastrous defeat in Iraq. Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today" if Saddam Hussein had remained in power. He denies he made a mistake in not sending a bigger US force to Iraq in 2003.

It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said.
